grading_system.description: Placer County uses a color-coded placard system rather than letter grades or numerical scores. Green = Pass (no major violations), Yellow = Conditional Pass (major violations present), Red = Closed (imminent health hazards)

inspection_details.frequency: Periodic, unannounced inspections by assigned Environmental Health Specialists - specific risk-based frequency not specified in available sources
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Major violations remaining uncorrected after routine inspection, failure to comply with compliance agreement, or imminent health hazards requiring closure
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Color-coded placards must be posted in clearly visible location to patrons; recent inspection reports available online for public review

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Local Fire Department (varies by jurisdiction within county)
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: NFPA 96 compliant fire suppression systems required for Type I hoods covering commercial cooking equipment - semi-annual inspections required
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Every six months by licensed fire protection company per NFPA 96

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - California Health and Safety Code Section 113700 et seq.
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level enforcement - Placer County Environmental Health Specialists conduct inspections and issue permits
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Placer County Retail Food Facility Placard Program ordinance adopted and incorporated by reference to CalCode

confidence_notes: Information verified from official Placer County Environmental Health sources including department website, ordinances, and official documents. Placard system clearly documented with specific criteria.
verification_notes: All key information verified from official county sources. Placer County uses color-coded placards (Green/Yellow/Red) rather than letter grades or numerical scores, which is clearly documented in their ordinance and website materials.
